titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joe David Bellamy Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:12

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, research and writing files, production files, audiocassettes, professional papers, printed material, a computer disk, and other papers, documenting Bellamy's work as an author and editor, as director of the Literature Program of the National Endowment for the Arts, and as editor and publisher of Fiction International magazine.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Ralph B. Sipper on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund and the Sinclair Lewis Fund, 2000-2007, and gift of Joe David Bellamy, 2014.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 48, 76 (audiocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 77, 79 (born digital): Restricted fragile material. Reference copy of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Joe David Bellamy Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joe David Bellamy Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, and competing priorities. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, at or around the time of acquisition. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, titled according to month and year of acquisition.

Descriptive information is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
Formerly classed as: Uncat MSS 63, Uncat MSS 892, Uncat MSS 987.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Books from the Bellamy collection are cataloged separately, with their provenance traced.

bioghist.head: Joe David Bellamy
bioghist.p: Joe David Bellamy was born in Cincinnati, Ohio in 1941. He attended Duke University, Antioch College, and the University of Iowa Writers' Workshop. He is the author of the novel Suzi Sinzinnati and the collection of stories Atomic Love in addition to other works. He was the founding editor and publisher of Fiction International magazine and press. He served as director of the literary program of the National Endowment for the Arts from 1990 to 1992.
Further biographical information can be found on the author's website: http://joedavidbellamy.com/.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, research and writing files, production files, audiocassettes, professional papers, printed material and other papers, documenting Bellamy's work as an author and editor, as director of the Literature Program of the National Endowment for the Arts, and as editor and publisher of Fiction International magazine.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four groupings: I. June 2000 Acquisition. II. August 2006 Acquisition. III. October 2007 Acquisition. IV. May 2014 Acquisition.
Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time.

Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with and/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, writings can be found in all three groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

controlaccess.corpname: National Endowment for the Arts. Literature Program

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection contains correspondence, research files, audiocassettes, and other papers related to Joe David Bellamy, the National Endowment for the Arts, The Falcon Magazine and other magazines and organizations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subgroupings: Correspondence, and Writing, Editorial, and Project Files.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 48 (audiocassettes): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection contains Fiction International, writings, production files and proofs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eight subgroupings: Correspondence, New Fiction Files, Fiction International Files, Writing Files, Writings by Others, Professional Papers, Other Papers, and Audiocassettes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection includes correspondence, writings, research files, printed material and other papers.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxe 76 (audiocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 77 (computer disk): Restricted Fragile Material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There is an audiocassette related to this material. It includes a recording of two phone calls from Annie Dillard to Bellamy, as well as one phone call from Gail Godwin to Bellamy. It can be found in Box 76.

relatedmaterial.p: This audiocassette is related to a folder of material titled "Annie Dillard" in Box 59, reference number 996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a second printing of Four Color Comics #223 April 1949, Walt Disney's Donald Duck in Lost in the Andes! , which has been signed and dedicated to Bellamy by Albert Goldbarth.

did.unittitle: McGraw, Peter and Milena, with Peter's Mother

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to the Parks family, who had inspired characters within Bellamy's novel, Suzi Sinzinnati .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files consist of interviews and other material stemming from Bellamy's work on the book The New Fiction: Interviews with Innovative American Writers (circa 1974).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files consist of correspondence, grant applications, and other material stemming from Bellamy's work as editor of the literary journal, Fiction International .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These files consist of drafts and manuscripts for books and associated documentation, and other material broadly relating to Bellamy's various literary endeavors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
